reviews.text: Good to get to different places but could do with some investment for how busy it is.
Nice station. Came out of nowhere. Recommended if it serves the stops you are after

There is nowhere quite like home. This station, only a short distance from the bigger Bath Spa, has certainly been spruced up over time, albeit gradually due to the voluntary work that has been carried out.
The station has 2 platforms and is is generally only served by local stopping services to Bristol, Great Malvern and Cardiff (Platform 1) and Bath, Portsmouth and Weymouth (Platform 2). Other locations may be covered at peak times.
The ticket office on Platform 1 is open between 6 and 10 am on weekdays only.
The station now sports the new standard electronic displays and announcement system, as seen across most of the GWR network.
On a gloriously sunny day, this is always a place to observe a spot of wildlife with a foot path passing along the side of the station.
The station is also near the main collection of shops on Moorland Road, which is definitely worth a visit.
Oldfield park, while small in size, is an important transport asset for its residents.
Not too crowded and quite quiet as well also they have now added electric timetables so that should help!

Not many facilities, but a relatively good stop for West Bath. It can get quite busy, but usually isn't. There are limited shelters, so when rainy it isn't great. The area is quite nice to look at though.
